Thread Network Directory.name: Thread Network Directory
Thread Network Directory.description: Manages the names and credentials of Thread networks visible to the user.

commands.name: AddNetwork
commands.description: Adds an entry to the ThreadNetworks list.

commands.name: RemoveNetwork
commands.description: Removes an entry from the ThreadNetworks list.

commands.name: GetOperationalDataset
commands.description: Retrieves a Thread Operational Dataset from the ThreadNetworks list.

commands.name: OperationalDatasetResponse
commands.description: This is the response to a GetOperationalDataset request.

Door Lock.name: Door Lock
Door Lock.description: An interface to a generic way to secure a door

commands.name: LockDoor
commands.description: This command causes the lock device to lock the door.

commands.name: UnlockDoor
commands.description: This command causes the lock device to unlock the door.

commands.name: UnlockWithTimeout
commands.description: This command causes the lock device to unlock the door with a timeout parameter.

commands.name: SetWeekDaySchedule
commands.description: Set a weekly repeating schedule for a specified user.

commands.name: GetWeekDaySchedule
commands.description: Retrieve the specific weekly schedule for the specific user.

commands.name: GetWeekDayScheduleResponse
commands.description: Returns the weekly repeating schedule data for the specified schedule index.

commands.name: ClearWeekDaySchedule
commands.description: Clear the specific weekly schedule or all weekly schedules for the specific user.

commands.name: SetYearDaySchedule
commands.description: Set a time-specific schedule ID for a specified user.

commands.name: GetYearDaySchedule
commands.description: Returns the year day schedule data for the specified schedule and user indexes.

commands.name: GetYearDayScheduleResponse
commands.description: Returns the year day schedule data for the specified schedule and user indexes.

commands.name: ClearYearDaySchedule
commands.description: Clears the specific year day schedule or all year day schedules for the specific user.

commands.name: SetHolidaySchedule
commands.description: Set the holiday Schedule by specifying local start time and local end time with respect to any Lock Operating Mode.

commands.name: GetHolidaySchedule
commands.description: Get the holiday schedule for the specified index.

commands.name: GetHolidayScheduleResponse
commands.description: Returns the Holiday Schedule Entry for the specified Holiday ID.

commands.name: ClearHolidaySchedule
commands.description: Clears the holiday schedule or all holiday schedules.

commands.name: SetUser
commands.description: Set User into the lock.

commands.name: GetUser
commands.description: Retrieve User.

commands.name: GetUserResponse
commands.description: Returns the User for the specified UserIndex.

commands.name: ClearUser
commands.description: Clears a User or all Users.

commands.name: SetCredential
commands.description: Set a credential (e.g. PIN, RFID, Fingerprint, etc.) into the lock for a new user, existing user, or ProgrammingUser.

commands.name: SetCredentialResponse
commands.description: Returns the status for setting the specified credential.

commands.name: GetCredentialStatus
commands.description: Retrieve the status of a particular credential (e.g. PIN, RFID, Fingerprint, etc.) by index.

commands.name: GetCredentialStatusResponse
commands.description: Returns the status for the specified credential.

commands.name: ClearCredential
commands.description: Clear one, one type, or all credentials except ProgrammingPIN credential.

commands.name: UnboltDoor
commands.description: This command causes the lock device to unlock the door without pulling the latch.

commands.name: SetAliroReaderConfig
commands.description: This command communicates an Aliro Reader configuration to the lock.

commands.name: ClearAliroReaderConfig
commands.description: This command clears an existing Aliro Reader configuration for the lock.

events.name: DoorLockAlarm
events.description: The door lock cluster provides several alarms which can be sent when there is a critical state on the door lock.

events.name: DoorStateChange
events.description: The door lock server sends out a DoorStateChange event when the door lock door state changes.

events.name: LockOperation
events.description: The door lock server sends out a LockOperation event when the event is triggered by the various lock operation sources.

events.name: LockOperationError
events.description: The door lock server sends out a LockOperationError event when a lock operation fails for various reasons.

events.name: LockUserChange
events.description: The door lock server sends out a LockUserChange event when a lock user, schedule, or credential change has occurred.

Content Launcher.name: Content Launcher
Content Launcher.description: This cluster provides an interface for launching content on a media player device such as a TV or Speaker.

commands.name: LaunchContent
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL launch the specified content with optional search criteria.

commands.name: LaunchURL
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL launch content from the specified URL.

commands.name: LauncherResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated in response to LaunchContent command.

Switch.name: Switch
Switch.description:
This cluster exposes interactions with a switch device, for the purpose of using those interactions by other devices.
Two types of switch devices are supported: latching switch (e.g. rocker switch) and momentary switch (e.g. push button), distinguished with their feature flags.
Interactions with the switch device are exposed as attributes (for the latching switch) and as events (for both types of switches). An interested party MAY subscribe to these attributes/events and thus be informed of the interactions, and can perform actions based on this, for example by sending commands to perform an action such as controlling a light or a window shade.

events.name: SwitchLatched
events.description: SwitchLatched

events.name: InitialPress
events.description: InitialPress

events.name: LongPress
events.description: LongPress

events.name: ShortRelease
events.description: ShortRelease

events.name: LongRelease
events.description: LongRelease

events.name: MultiPressOngoing
events.description: MultiPressOngoing

events.name: MultiPressComplete
events.description: MultiPressComplete

Thermostat User Interface Configuration.name: Thermostat User Interface Configuration
Thermostat User Interface Configuration.description: An interface for configuring the user interface of a thermostat (which may be remote from the thermostat).

Relative Humidity Measurement.name: Relative Humidity Measurement
Relative Humidity Measurement.description: Attributes and commands for configuring the measurement of relative humidity, and reporting relative humidity measurements.

Commissioner Control.name: Commissioner Control
Commissioner Control.description: Supports the ability for clients to request the commissioning of themselves or other nodes onto a fabric which the cluster server can commission onto.

commands.name: RequestCommissioningApproval
commands.description: This command is sent by a client to request approval for a future CommissionNode call.

commands.name: CommissionNode
commands.description: This command is sent by a client to request that the server begins commissioning a previously approved request.

commands.name: ReverseOpenCommissioningWindow
commands.description: When received within the timeout specified by CommissionNode, the client SHALL open a commissioning window on to the node which the client called RequestCommissioningApproval to have commissioned.

events.name: CommissioningRequestResult
events.description: This event SHALL be sent by the server following a RequestCommissioningApproval command which the server responded to with SUCCESS.

Time Synchronization.name: Time Synchronization
Time Synchronization.description: Accurate time is required for a number of reasons, including scheduling, display and validating security materials.

commands.name: SetUTCTime
commands.description: This command MAY be issued by Administrator to set the time.

commands.name: SetTrustedTimeSource
commands.description: This command SHALL set TrustedTimeSource.

commands.name: SetTimeZone
commands.description: This command SHALL set TimeZone.

commands.name: SetTimeZoneResponse
commands.description: Response to SetTimeZone.

commands.name: SetDSTOffset
commands.description: This command SHALL set DSTOffset.

commands.name: SetDefaultNTP
commands.description: This command is used to set DefaultNTP.

events.name: DSTTableEmpty
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when the server stops applying the current DSTOffset and there are no entries in the list with a larger ValidStarting time.

events.name: DSTStatus
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when the server starts or stops applying a DST offset.

events.name: TimeZoneStatus
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when the server changes its time zone offset or name.

events.name: TimeFailure
events.description: This event SHALL be generated if the node has attempted to update its time, but was unable to find a good time from any source.

events.name: MissingTrustedTimeSource
events.description: This event SHALL be generated if the node attempts to update its time and finds that the TrustedTimeSource is null, or the specified peer cannot be reached.

Power Source.name: Power Source
Power Source.description: This cluster is used to describe the configuration and capabilities of a physical power source that provides power to the Node.

events.name: WiredFaultChange
events.description: The WiredFaultChange Event SHALL indicate a change in the set of wired faults currently detected by the Node on this wired power source.

events.name: BatFaultChange
events.description: The BatFaultChange Event SHALL indicate a change in the set of battery faults currently detected by the Node on this battery power source.

events.name: BatChargeFaultChange
events.description: The BatChargeFaultChange Event SHALL indicate a change in the set of charge faults currently detected by the Node on this battery power source.

Messages.name: Messages
Messages.description: This cluster provides an interface for passing messages to be presented by a device.

commands.name: PresentMessagesRequest
commands.description: Command for requesting messages be presented

commands.name: CancelMessagesRequest
commands.description: Command for cancelling message present requests

events.name: MessageQueued
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when the message is confirmed by the user, or when the expiration date of the message is reached.

events.name: MessagePresented
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when the message is presented to the user.

events.name: MessageComplete
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when the message is confirmed by the user, or when the expiration date of the message is reached.

Microwave Oven Control.name: Microwave Oven Control
Microwave Oven Control.description: Attributes and commands for configuring the microwave oven control, and reporting cooking stats.

commands.name: SetCookingParameters
commands.description: Set Cooking Parameters

commands.name: AddMoreTime
commands.description: Add More Cooking Time

Thread Network Diagnostics.name: Thread Network Diagnostics
Thread Network Diagnostics.description: The Thread Network Diagnostics Cluster provides a means to acquire standardized diagnostics metrics that MAY be used by a Node to assist a user or Administrative Node in diagnosing potential problems

commands.name: ResetCounts
commands.description: Reception of this command SHALL reset the OverrunCount attributes to 0

events.name: ConnectionStatus
events.description: Indicate that a Nodes connection status to a Thread network has changed

events.name: NetworkFaultChange
events.description: Indicate a change in the set of network faults currently detected by the Node

Software Diagnostics.name: Software Diagnostics
Software Diagnostics.description: The Software Diagnostics Cluster provides a means to acquire standardized diagnostics metrics that MAY be used by a Node to assist a user or Administrative Node in diagnosing potential problems.

commands.name: ResetWatermarks
commands.description: Reception of this command SHALL reset the values: The StackFreeMinimum field of the ThreadMetrics attribute, CurrentHeapHighWaterMark attribute.

events.name: SoftwareFault
events.description: Indicate the last software fault that has taken place on the Node.

Microwave Oven Mode.name: Microwave Oven Mode
Microwave Oven Mode.description: Attributes and commands for selecting a mode from a list of supported options.

RVC Clean Mode.name: RVC Clean Mode
RVC Clean Mode.description: Attributes and commands for selecting a mode from a list of supported options.

commands.name: ChangeToMode
commands.description:
This command is used to change device modes.
        On receipt of this command the device SHALL respond with a ChangeToModeResponse command.

commands.name: ChangeToModeResponse
commands.description: This command is sent by the device on receipt of the ChangeToModeWithStatus command.

Power Source Configuration.name: Power Source Configuration
Power Source Configuration.description: This cluster is used to describe the configuration and capabilities of a Device's power system.

Power Topology.name: Power Topology
Power Topology.description: The Power Topology Cluster provides a mechanism for expressing how power is flowing between endpoints.

Group Key Management.name: Group Key Management
Group Key Management.description: The Group Key Management Cluster is the mechanism by which group keys are managed.

commands.name: KeySetWrite
commands.description: Write a new set of keys for the given key set id.

commands.name: KeySetRead
commands.description: Read the keys for a given key set id.

commands.name: KeySetReadResponse
commands.description: Response to KeySetRead

commands.name: KeySetRemove
commands.description: Revoke a Root Key from a Group

commands.name: KeySetReadAllIndices
commands.description: Return the list of Group Key Sets associated with the accessing fabric

commands.name: KeySetReadAllIndicesResponse
commands.description: Reseponse to KeySetReadAllIndices

WebRTC Transport Requestor.name: WebRTC Transport Requestor
WebRTC Transport Requestor.description: The WebRTC transport requestor cluster provides a way for stream consumers (e.g. Matter Stream Viewer) to establish a WebRTC connection with a stream provider.

commands.name: Offer
commands.description: This command provides the stream requestor with WebRTC session details.

commands.name: Answer
commands.description: This command provides the stream requestor with the WebRTC session details (i.e. Session ID and SDP answer), It is the next command in the Offer/Answer flow to the ProvideOffer command.

commands.name: ICECandidates
commands.description: This command allows for string based https://rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc8839#section-5.1 generated after the initial Offer / Answer exchange, via a JSEP https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc9429#section-4.1.20 event, a DOM https://www.w3.org/TR/webrtc/#dom-rtcpeerconnectioniceevent event, or other WebRTC compliant implementations, to be added to a session during the gathering phase.

commands.name: End
commands.description: This command notifies the stream requestor that the provider has ended the WebRTC session.

Zone Management.name: Zone Management
Zone Management.description: This cluster provides an interface to manage regions of interest, or Zones, which can be either manufacturer or user defined.

commands.name: CreateTwoDCartesianZone
commands.description: This command SHALL create and store a TwoD Cartesian Zone.

commands.name: UpdateTwoDCartesianZone
commands.description: The UpdateTwoDCartesianZone SHALL update a stored TwoD Cartesian Zone.

commands.name: GetTwoDCartesianZone
commands.description: The GetTwoDCartesianZone SHALL return the TwoD Cartesian Zone for the passed in ZoneID.

commands.name: GetTwoDCartesianZoneResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated in response to a GetTwoDCartesianZone command.

commands.name: RemoveZone
commands.description: This command SHALL remove the Zone mapped to the passed in ZoneID.

events.name: ZoneTriggered
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when a Zone is first triggered.

events.name: ZoneStopped
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when either when the TriggerDetectedDuration value is exceeded by the TimeSinceInitialTrigger value or when the MaxDuration value is exceeded by the TimeSinceInitialTrigger value as described in ZoneTriggerControlStruct.

Energy EVSE.name: Energy EVSE
Energy EVSE.description: Electric Vehicle Supply Equipment (EVSE) is equipment used to charge an Electric Vehicle (EV) or Plug-In Hybrid Electric Vehicle. This cluster provides an interface to the functionality of Electric Vehicle Supply Equipment (EVSE) management.

commands.name: Disable
commands.description: Allows a client to disable the EVSE from charging and discharging.

commands.name: EnableCharging
commands.description: This command allows a client to enable the EVSE to charge an EV, and to provide or update the maximum and minimum charge current.

commands.name: EnableDischarging
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL allow a client to enable the discharge of an EV, and to provide or update the maximum discharge current.

commands.name: StartDiagnostics
commands.description: Allows a client to put the EVSE into a self-diagnostics mode.

commands.name: SetTargets
commands.description: Allows a client to set the user specified charging targets.

commands.name: GetTargets
commands.description: Allows a client to retrieve the current set of charging targets.

commands.name: ClearTargets
commands.description: Allows a client to clear all stored charging targets.

commands.name: GetTargetsResponse
commands.description: The GetTargetsResponse is sent in response to the GetTargets Command.

events.name: EVConnected
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when the EV is plugged in.

events.name: EVNotDetected
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when the EV is unplugged or not detected (having been previously plugged in).

events.name: EnergyTransferStarted
events.description: This event SHALL be generated whenever the EV starts charging or discharging, except when an EV has switched between charging and discharging under the control of the PowerAdjustment feature of the Device Energy Management cluster of the associated Device Energy Management device.

events.name: EnergyTransferStopped
events.description: This event SHALL be generated whenever the EV stops charging or discharging, except when an EV has switched between charging and discharging under the control of the PowerAdjustment feature of the Device Energy Management cluster of the associated Device Energy Management device.

events.name: Fault
events.description: If the EVSE detects a fault it SHALL generate a Fault Event.

events.name: RFID
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when a RFID card has been read.

Water Heater Management.name: Water Heater Management
Water Heater Management.description: This cluster is used to allow clients to control the operation of a hot water heating appliance so that it can be used with energy management.

commands.name: Boost
commands.description: Allows a client to request that the water heater is put into a Boost state.

commands.name: CancelBoost
commands.description: Allows a client to cancel an ongoing Boost operation.

events.name: BoostStarted
events.description: This event SHALL be generated whenever a Boost command is accepted.

events.name: BoostEnded
events.description: This event SHALL be generated whenever the BoostState transitions from Active to Inactive.

Pressure Measurement.name: Pressure Measurement
Pressure Measurement.description: Attributes and commands for configuring the measurement of pressure, and reporting pressure measurements.

Operational Credentials.name: Operational Credentials
Operational Credentials.description: This cluster is used to add or remove Operational Credentials on a Commissionee or Node, as well as manage the associated Fabrics.

commands.name: AttestationRequest
commands.description: Sender is requesting attestation information from the receiver.

commands.name: AttestationResponse
commands.description: An attestation information confirmation from the server.

commands.name: CertificateChainRequest
commands.description: Sender is requesting a device attestation certificate from the receiver.

commands.name: CertificateChainResponse
commands.description: A device attestation certificate (DAC) or product attestation intermediate (PAI) certificate from the server.

commands.name: CSRRequest
commands.description: Sender is requesting a certificate signing request (CSR) from the receiver.

commands.name: CSRResponse
commands.description: A certificate signing request (CSR) from the server.

commands.name: AddNOC
commands.description: Sender is requesting to add the new node operational certificates.

commands.name: UpdateNOC
commands.description: Sender is requesting to update the node operational certificates.

commands.name: NOCResponse
commands.description: Response to AddNOC or UpdateNOC commands.

commands.name: UpdateFabricLabel
commands.description: This command SHALL be used by an Administrative Node to set the user-visible Label field for a given Fabric, as reflected by entries in the Fabrics attribute.

commands.name: RemoveFabric
commands.description: This command is used by Administrative Nodes to remove a given fabric index and delete all associated fabric-scoped data.

commands.name: AddTrustedRootCertificate
commands.description: This command SHALL add a Trusted Root CA Certificate, provided as its CHIP Certificate representation.

commands.name: SetVidVerificationStatement
commands.description: This command SHALL be used to update any of the accessing fabric's associated VendorID, VidVerificatioNStatement or VVSC (Vendor Verification Signing Certificate).

commands.name: SignVidVerificationRequest
commands.description: This command SHALL be used to request that the server authenticate the fabric associated with the FabricIndex given.

commands.name: SignVidVerificationResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL contain the response of the SignVidVerificationRequest.

RVC Run Mode.name: RVC Run Mode
RVC Run Mode.description: Attributes and commands for selecting a mode from a list of supported options.

commands.name: ChangeToMode
commands.description:
This command is used to change device modes.
        On receipt of this command the device SHALL respond with a ChangeToModeResponse command.

commands.name: ChangeToModeResponse
commands.description: This command is sent by the device on receipt of the ChangeToModeWithStatus command.

Boolean State.name: Boolean State
Boolean State.description: This cluster provides an interface to a boolean state called StateValue.

events.name: StateChange
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when the StateValue attribute changes.

Laundry Washer Mode.name: Laundry Washer Mode
Laundry Washer Mode.description: Attributes and commands for selecting a mode from a list of supported options.

commands.name: ChangeToMode
commands.description:
This command is used to change device modes.
        On receipt of this command the device SHALL respond with a ChangeToModeResponse command.

commands.name: ChangeToModeResponse
commands.description: This command is sent by the device on receipt of the ChangeToModeWithStatus command.

Fault Injection.name: Fault Injection
Fault Injection.description: The Fault Injection Cluster provide a means for a test harness to configure faults(for example triggering a fault in the system).

commands.name: FailAtFault
commands.description: Configure a fault to be triggered deterministically

commands.name: FailRandomlyAtFault
commands.description: Configure a fault to be triggered randomly, with a given probability defined as a percentage

Application Launcher.name: Application Launcher
Application Launcher.description: This cluster provides an interface for launching content on a media player device such as a TV or Speaker.

commands.name: LaunchApp
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL launch the specified app with optional data. The TV Device SHALL launch and bring to foreground the identified application in the command if the application is not already launched and in foreground. The TV Device SHALL update state attribute on the Application Basic cluster of the Endpoint corresponding to the launched application. This command returns a Launch Response.

commands.name: StopApp
commands.description: Upon receipt on a Video Player endpoint this SHALL stop the specified application if it is running.

commands.name: HideApp
commands.description: Upon receipt on a Video Player endpoint this SHALL hide the specified application if it is running and visible.

commands.name: LauncherResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated in response to LaunchApp commands.

ICD Management.name: ICD Management
ICD Management.description: Allows servers to ensure that listed clients are notified when a server is available for communication.

commands.name: RegisterClient
commands.description: Register a client to the end device

commands.name: RegisterClientResponse
commands.description: RegisterClient response command

commands.name: UnregisterClient
commands.description: Unregister a client from an end device

commands.name: StayActiveRequest
commands.description: Request the end device to stay in Active Mode for an additional ActiveModeThreshold

commands.name: StayActiveResponse
commands.description: StayActiveRequest response command

Thread Border Router Management.name: Thread Border Router Management
Thread Border Router Management.description: Manage the Thread network of Thread Border Router

commands.name: GetActiveDatasetRequest
commands.description: Command to request the active operational dataset of the Thread network to which the border router is connected. This command must be sent over a valid CASE session

commands.name: GetPendingDatasetRequest
commands.description: Command to request the pending dataset of the Thread network to which the border router is connected. This command must be sent over a valid CASE session

commands.name: DatasetResponse
commands.description: Generated response to GetActiveDatasetRequest or GetPendingDatasetRequest commands.

commands.name: SetActiveDatasetRequest
commands.description: Command to set or update the active Dataset of the Thread network to which the Border Router is connected.

commands.name: SetPendingDatasetRequest
commands.description: Command set or update the pending Dataset of the Thread network to which the Border Router is connected.

Media Playback.name: Media Playback
Media Playback.description: This cluster provides an interface for controlling Media Playback (PLAY, PAUSE, etc) on a media device such as a TV or Speaker.

commands.name: Play
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL play media.

commands.name: Pause
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL pause media.

commands.name: Stop
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL stop media. User experience is context-specific. This will often navigate the user back to the location where media was originally launched.

commands.name: StartOver
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL Start Over with the current media playback item.

commands.name: Previous
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL cause the handler to be invoked for "Previous". User experience is context-specific. This will often Go back to the previous media playback item.

commands.name: Next
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL cause the handler to be invoked for "Next". User experience is context-specific. This will often Go forward to the next media playback item.

commands.name: Rewind
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL Rewind through media. Different Rewind speeds can be used on the TV based upon the number of sequential calls to this function. This is to avoid needing to define every speed now (multiple fast, slow motion, etc).

commands.name: FastForward
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL Advance through media. Different FF speeds can be used on the TV based upon the number of sequential calls to this function. This is to avoid needing to define every speed now (multiple fast, slow motion, etc).

commands.name: SkipForward
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL Skip forward in the media by the given number of seconds, using the data as follows:

commands.name: SkipBackward
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL Skip backward in the media by the given number of seconds, using the data as follows:

commands.name: Seek
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL Skip backward in the media by the given number of seconds, using the data as follows:

commands.name: PlaybackResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated in response to various Playback Request commands.

commands.name: ActivateAudioTrack
commands.description: Upon receipt, the server SHALL set the active Audio Track to the one identified by the TrackID in the Track catalog for the streaming media. If the TrackID does not exist in the Track catalog, OR does not correspond to the streaming media OR no media is being streamed at the time of receipt of this command, the server will return an error status of INVALID_ARGUMENT.

commands.name: ActivateTextTrack
commands.description: Upon receipt, the server SHALL set the active Text Track to the one identified by the TrackID in the Track catalog for the streaming media. If the TrackID does not exist in the Track catalog, OR does not correspond to the streaming media OR no media is being streamed at the time of receipt of this command, the server SHALL return an error status of INVALID_ARGUMENT.

commands.name: DeactivateTextTrack
commands.description: If a Text Track is active (i.e. being displayed), upon receipt of this command, the server SHALL stop displaying it.

events.name: StateChanged
events.description: If supported, this event SHALL be generated when there is a change in any of the supported attributes of the Media Playback cluster.

Bridged Device Basic Information.name: Bridged Device Basic Information
Bridged Device Basic Information.description:
This Cluster serves two purposes towards a Node communicating with a Bridge: indicate that the functionality on
          the Endpoint where it is placed (and its Parts) is bridged from a non-CHIP technology; and provide a centralized
          collection of attributes that the Node MAY collect to aid in conveying information regarding the Bridged Device to a user,
          such as the vendor name, the model name, or user-assigned name.

commands.name: KeepActive
commands.description: The server SHALL attempt to keep the devices specified active for StayActiveDuration milliseconds when they are next active.

events.name: StartUp
events.description: The StartUp event SHALL be emitted by a Node as soon as reasonable after completing a boot or reboot process.

events.name: ShutDown
events.description: The ShutDown event SHOULD be emitted by a Node prior to any orderly shutdown sequence on a best-effort basis.

events.name: Leave
events.description: The Leave event SHOULD be emitted by a Node prior to permanently leaving the Fabric.

events.name: ReachableChanged
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when there is a change in the Reachable attribute.

events.name: ActiveChanged
events.description: This event (when supported) SHALL be generated the next time a bridged device becomes active after a KeepActive command is received.

Actions.name: Actions
Actions.description: This cluster provides a standardized way for a Node (typically a Bridge, but could be any Node) to expose action information.

commands.name: InstantAction
commands.description: This command triggers an action (state change) on the involved endpoints.

commands.name: InstantActionWithTransition
commands.description: This command triggers an action (state change) on the involved endpoints, with a specified time to transition from the current state to the new state.

commands.name: StartAction
commands.description: This command triggers the commencement of an action on the involved endpoints.

commands.name: StartActionWithDuration
commands.description: This command triggers the commencement of an action (with a duration) on the involved endpoints.

commands.name: StopAction
commands.description: This command stops the ongoing action on the involved endpoints.

commands.name: PauseAction
commands.description: This command pauses an ongoing action.

commands.name: PauseActionWithDuration
commands.description: This command pauses an ongoing action with a duration.

commands.name: ResumeAction
commands.description: This command resumes a previously paused action.

commands.name: EnableAction
commands.description: This command enables a certain action or automation.

commands.name: EnableActionWithDuration
commands.description: This command enables a certain action or automation with a duration.

commands.name: DisableAction
commands.description: This command disables a certain action or automation.

commands.name: DisableActionWithDuration
commands.description: This command disables a certain action or automation with a duration.

events.name: StateChanged
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when there is a change in the Status of an ActionID.

events.name: ActionFailed
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when there is some error which prevents the action from its normal planned execution.

General Commissioning.name: General Commissioning
General Commissioning.description: This cluster is used to manage global aspects of the Commissioning flow.

commands.name: ArmFailSafe
commands.description: Arm the persistent fail-safe timer with an expiry time of now + ExpiryLengthSeconds using device clock

commands.name: ArmFailSafeResponse
commands.description: Success/failure response for ArmFailSafe command

commands.name: SetRegulatoryConfig
commands.description: Set the regulatory configuration to be used during commissioning

commands.name: SetRegulatoryConfigResponse
commands.description: Success/failure response for SetRegulatoryConfig command

commands.name: CommissioningComplete
commands.description: Signals the Server that the Client has successfully completed all steps of Commissioning/Recofiguration needed during fail-safe period.

commands.name: CommissioningCompleteResponse
commands.description: Indicates to client whether CommissioningComplete command succeeded

commands.name: SetTCAcknowledgements
commands.description: This command sets the user acknowledgements received in the Enhanced Setup Flow Terms and Conditions into the node.

commands.name: SetTCAcknowledgementsResponse
commands.description: This command is used to convey the result from SetTCAcknowledgements.

Ballast Configuration.name: Ballast Configuration
Ballast Configuration.description: Attributes and commands for configuring a lighting ballast.

Wi-Fi Network Management.name: Wi-Fi Network Management
Wi-Fi Network Management.description: Functionality to retrieve operational information about a managed Wi-Fi network.

commands.name: NetworkPassphraseRequest
commands.description: Request the current WPA-Personal passphrase or PSK associated with the managed Wi-Fi network.

commands.name: NetworkPassphraseResponse
commands.description: This is the response to a NetworkPassphraseRequest.

RVC Operational State.name: RVC Operational State
RVC Operational State.description: This cluster supports remotely monitoring and, where supported, changing the operational state of a Robotic Vacuum.

commands.name: Pause
commands.description: Upon receipt, the device SHALL pause its operation if it is possible based on the current function of the server.

commands.name: Resume
commands.description: Upon receipt, the device SHALL resume its operation from the point it was at when it received the Pause command, or from the point when it was paused by means outside of this cluster (for example by manual button press).

commands.name: OperationalCommandResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated in response to any of the Start, Stop, Pause, or Resume commands.

commands.name: GoHome
commands.description: On receipt of this command, the device SHALL start seeking the charging dock, if possible in the current state of the device.

events.name: OperationalError
events.description: OperationalError

events.name: OperationCompletion
events.description: OperationCompletion

Unit Localization.name: Unit Localization
Unit Localization.description:
Nodes should be expected to be deployed to any and all regions of the world. These global regions
      may have differing preferences for the units in which values are conveyed in communication to a
      user. As such, Nodes that visually or audibly convey measurable values to the user need a
      mechanism by which they can be configured to use a users preferred unit.

OTA Software Update Provider.name: OTA Software Update Provider
OTA Software Update Provider.description: Provides an interface for providing OTA software updates

commands.name: QueryImage
commands.description: Determine availability of a new Software Image

commands.name: QueryImageResponse
commands.description: Response to QueryImage command

commands.name: ApplyUpdateRequest
commands.description: Determine next action to take for a downloaded Software Image

commands.name: ApplyUpdateResponse
commands.description: Reponse to ApplyUpdateRequest command

commands.name: NotifyUpdateApplied
commands.description: Notify OTA Provider that an update was applied

OTA Software Update Requestor.name: OTA Software Update Requestor
OTA Software Update Requestor.description: Provides an interface for downloading and applying OTA software updates

commands.name: AnnounceOTAProvider
commands.description: Announce the presence of an OTA Provider

events.name: StateTransition
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when a change of the UpdateState attribute occurs due to an OTA Requestor moving through the states necessary to query for updates.

events.name: VersionApplied
events.description: This event SHALL be generated whenever a new version starts executing after being applied due to a software update.

events.name: DownloadError
events.description: This event SHALL be generated whenever an error occurs during OTA Requestor download operation.

Oven Mode.name: Oven Mode
Oven Mode.description: Attributes and commands for selecting a mode from a list of supported options.

commands.name: ChangeToMode
commands.description:
This command is used to change device modes.
        On receipt of this command the device SHALL respond with a ChangeToModeResponse command.

commands.name: ChangeToModeResponse
commands.description: This command is sent by the device on receipt of the ChangeToModeWithStatus command.

Valve Configuration and Control.name: Valve Configuration and Control
Valve Configuration and Control.description: This cluster is used to configure a valve.

commands.name: Open
commands.description: This command is used to set the valve to its open position.

commands.name: Close
commands.description: This command is used to set the valve to its closed position.

events.name: ValveStateChanged
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when the valve state changed.

events.name: ValveFault
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when the valve registers or clears a fault.

Laundry Dryer Controls.name: Laundry Dryer Controls
Laundry Dryer Controls.description:
This cluster provides a way to access options associated with the operation of
            a laundry dryer device type.

Sample MEI.name: Sample MEI
Sample MEI.description: The Sample MEI cluster showcases a cluster manufacturer extensions

commands.name: AddArgumentsResponse
commands.description: Response for AddArguments that returns the sum.

commands.name: AddArguments
commands.description: Command that takes two uint8 arguments and returns their sum.

commands.name: Ping
commands.description: Simple command without any parameters and without a response.

events.name: PingCountEvent
events.description: Example events generated by Ping command

Window Covering.name: Window Covering
Window Covering.description: Provides an interface for controlling and adjusting automatic window coverings.

commands.name: UpOrOpen
commands.description: Moves window covering to InstalledOpenLimitLift and InstalledOpenLimitTilt

commands.name: DownOrClose
commands.description: Moves window covering to InstalledClosedLimitLift and InstalledCloseLimitTilt

commands.name: StopMotion
commands.description: Stop any adjusting of window covering

commands.name: GoToLiftValue
commands.description: Go to lift value specified

commands.name: GoToLiftPercentage
commands.description: Go to lift percentage specified

commands.name: GoToTiltValue
commands.description: Go to tilt value specified

commands.name: GoToTiltPercentage
commands.description: Go to tilt percentage specified

Camera AV Settings User Level Management.name: Camera AV Settings User Level Management
Camera AV Settings User Level Management.description: This cluster provides an interface into controls associated with the operation of a device that provides pan, tilt, and zoom functions, either mechanically, or against a digital image.

commands.name: MPTZSetPosition
commands.description: This command SHALL set the values for the pan, tilt, and zoom in the mechanical PTZ.

commands.name: MPTZRelativeMove
commands.description: This command SHALL move the device by the delta values relative to the currently defined position.

commands.name: MPTZMoveToPreset
commands.description: This command SHALL move the camera to the positions specified by the Preset passed.

commands.name: MPTZSavePreset
commands.description: This command allows creating a new preset or updating the values of an existing one.

commands.name: MPTZRemovePreset
commands.description: This command SHALL remove a preset entry from the PresetMptzTable.

commands.name: DPTZSetViewport
commands.description: This command allows for setting the digital viewport for a specific Video Stream.

commands.name: DPTZRelativeMove
commands.description: This command SHALL change the viewports location by the amount specified in a relative fashion.

TLS Certificate Management.name: TLS Certificate Management
TLS Certificate Management.description:
This Cluster is used to manage TLS Client Certificates and to provision
      TLS endpoints with enough information to facilitate subsequent connection.

commands.name: ProvisionRootCertificate
commands.description: This command SHALL provision the provided certificate for the passed in CAID.

commands.name: ProvisionRootCertificateResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated in response to a ProvisionRootCertificate command.

commands.name: FindRootCertificate
commands.description: This command SHALL return the TLSCertStruct for the passed in CAID.

commands.name: FindRootCertificateResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated in response to a FindRootCertificate command.

commands.name: LookupRootCertificate
commands.description: This command SHALL return the CAID for the passed in fingerprint.

commands.name: LookupRootCertificateResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated in response to a LookupRootCertificate command.

commands.name: RemoveRootCertificate
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated to request the server removes the certificate provisioned to the provided Certificate Authority ID.

commands.name: TLSClientCSR
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated to request the Node generates a Certificate Signing Request.

commands.name: TLSClientCSRResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated in response to a TLSClientCSR command.

commands.name: ProvisionClientCertificate
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated to request the Node provisions the provided Client Certificate Details.

commands.name: ProvisionClientCertificateResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated in response to a ProvisionClientCertificate command.

commands.name: FindClientCertificate
commands.description: This command SHALL return the TLSClientCertificateDetailStruct for the passed in CCDID.

commands.name: FindClientCertificateResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated in response to a FindClientCertificate command.

commands.name: LookupClientCertificate
commands.description: This command SHALL return the CCDID for the passed in Fingerprint.

commands.name: LookupClientCertificateResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated in response to a LookupClientCertificate command.

commands.name: RemoveClientCertificate
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated to request the Node removes the certificate provisioned to the provided Client Certificate Details ID.

Content App Observer.name: Content App Observer
Content App Observer.description: This cluster provides an interface for sending targeted commands to an Observer of a Content App on a Video Player device such as a Streaming Media Player, Smart TV or Smart Screen. The cluster server for Content App Observer is implemented by an endpoint that communicates with a Content App, such as a Casting Video Client. The cluster client for Content App Observer is implemented by a Content App endpoint. A Content App is informed of the NodeId of an Observer when a binding is set on the Content App. The Content App can then send the ContentAppMessage to the Observer (server cluster), and the Observer responds with a ContentAppMessageResponse.

commands.name: ContentAppMessage
commands.description: Upon receipt, the data field MAY be parsed and interpreted. Message encoding is specific to the Content App. A Content App MAY when possible read attributes from the Basic Information Cluster on the Observer and use this to determine the Message encoding.

commands.name: ContentAppMessageResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated in response to ContentAppMessage command.

Keypad Input.name: Keypad Input
Keypad Input.description: This cluster provides an interface for controlling a device like a TV using action commands such as UP, DOWN, and SELECT.

commands.name: SendKey
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL process a keycode as input to the media device.

commands.name: SendKeyResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated in response to a SendKey Request command.

Application Basic.name: Application Basic
Application Basic.description: This cluster provides information about an application running on a TV or media player device which is represented as an endpoint.

Timer.name: Timer
Timer.description: This cluster supports creating a simple timer functionality.

commands.name: SetTimer
commands.description: This command is used to set the timer.

commands.name: ResetTimer
commands.description: This command is used to reset the timer to the original value.

commands.name: AddTime
commands.description: This command is used to add time to the existing timer.

commands.name: ReduceTime
commands.description: This command is used to reduce time on the existing timer.

Account Login.name: Account Login
Account Login.description: This cluster provides commands that facilitate user account login on a Content App or a node. For example, a Content App running on a Video Player device, which is represented as an endpoint (see [TV Architecture]), can use this cluster to help make the user account on the Content App match the user account on the Client.

commands.name: GetSetupPIN
commands.description: Upon receipt, the Content App checks if the account associated with the client Temp Account Identifier Rotating ID is the same acount that is active on the given Content App. If the accounts are the same, then the Content App includes the Setup PIN in the GetSetupPIN Response.

commands.name: Login
commands.description: Upon receipt, the Content App checks if the account associated with the clients Temp Account Identifier (Rotating ID) has a current active Setup PIN with the given value. If the Setup PIN is valid for the user account associated with the Temp Account Identifier, then the Content App MAY make that user account active.

commands.name: Logout
commands.description: The purpose of this command is to instruct the Content App to clear the current user account. This command SHOULD be used by clients of a Content App to indicate the end of a user session.

commands.name: GetSetupPINResponse
commands.description: This message is sent in response to the GetSetupPIN Request, and contains the Setup PIN code, or null when the accounts identified in the request does not match the active account of the running Content App.

events.name: LoggedOut
events.description: This event can be used by the Content App to indicate that the current user has logged out. In response to this event, the Fabric Admin SHALL remove access to this Content App by the specified Node. If no Node is provided, then the Fabric Admin SHALL remove access to all non-Admin Nodes.

Access Control.name: Access Control
Access Control.description:
The Access Control Cluster exposes a data model view of a
      Node's Access Control List (ACL), which codifies the rules used to manage
      and enforce Access Control for the Node's endpoints and their associated
      cluster instances.

commands.name: ReviewFabricRestrictions
commands.description: This command signals to the service associated with the device vendor that the fabric administrator would like a review of the current restrictions on the accessing fabric.

commands.name: ReviewFabricRestrictionsResponse
commands.description: Returns the review token for the request, which can be used to correlate with a FabricRestrictionReviewUpdate event.

events.name: AccessControlEntryChanged
events.description: The cluster SHALL send AccessControlEntryChanged events whenever its ACL attribute data is changed by an Administrator.

events.name: AccessControlExtensionChanged
events.description: The cluster SHALL send AccessControlExtensionChanged events whenever its extension attribute data is changed by an Administrator.

events.name: FabricRestrictionReviewUpdate
events.description: The cluster SHALL send FabricRestrictionReviewUpdate events to indicate completion of a fabric restriction review.

Closure Control.name: Closure Control
Closure Control.description: This cluster provides an interface for controlling a Closure device.

commands.name: Stop
commands.description: On receipt of this command, the device SHALL stop its operation if it is at a position where it is safe to do so and/or permitted.

commands.name: MoveTo
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL move the product in the most fitting state following the data as follows:

commands.name: Calibrate
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL initiate a calibration.

commands.name: ConfigureFallback
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL configure the Fallback feature behavior using the data as follows:

commands.name: CancelFallback
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL cancel the current PendingFallback.

Refrigerator Alarm.name: Refrigerator Alarm
Refrigerator Alarm.description: Attributes and commands for configuring the Refrigerator alarm.

events.name: Notify
events.description: Notify

Binding.name: Binding
Binding.description: The Binding Cluster is meant to replace the support from the Zigbee Device Object (ZDO) for supporting the binding table.

Identify.name: Identify
Identify.description: Attributes and commands for putting a device into Identification mode (e.g. flashing a light).

commands.name: Identify
commands.description: Command description for Identify

commands.name: TriggerEffect
commands.description: Command description for TriggerEffect

Network Commissioning.name: Network Commissioning
Network Commissioning.description: Functionality to configure, enable, disable network credentials and access on a Matter device.

commands.name: ScanNetworks
commands.description: Detemine the set of networks the device sees as available.

commands.name: ScanNetworksResponse
commands.description: Relay the set of networks the device sees as available back to the client.

commands.name: AddOrUpdateWiFiNetwork
commands.description: Add or update the credentials for a given Wi-Fi network.

commands.name: AddOrUpdateThreadNetwork
commands.description: Add or update the credentials for a given Thread network.

commands.name: RemoveNetwork
commands.description: Remove the definition of a given network (including its credentials).

commands.name: NetworkConfigResponse
commands.description: Response command for various commands that add/remove/modify network credentials.

commands.name: ConnectNetwork
commands.description: Connect to the specified network, using previously-defined credentials.

commands.name: ConnectNetworkResponse
commands.description: Command that indicates whether we have succcessfully connected to a network.

commands.name: ReorderNetwork
commands.description: Modify the order in which networks will be presented in the Networks attribute.

commands.name: QueryIdentity
commands.description: Retrieve details about and optionally proof of possession of a network client identity.

commands.name: QueryIdentityResponse
commands.description: Command that contains details about a network client identity and optionally a proof of possession.

Dishwasher Alarm.name: Dishwasher Alarm
Dishwasher Alarm.description: Attributes and commands for configuring the Dishwasher alarm.

commands.name: Reset
commands.description: Reset alarm

commands.name: ModifyEnabledAlarms
commands.description: Modify enabled alarms

events.name: Notify
events.description: Notify

Oven Cavity Operational State.name: Oven Cavity Operational State
Oven Cavity Operational State.description: This cluster supports remotely monitoring and, where supported, changing the operational state of an Oven.

commands.name: Pause
commands.description: Upon receipt, the device SHALL pause its operation if it is possible based on the current function of the server.

commands.name: Stop
commands.description: Upon receipt, the device SHALL stop its operation if it is at a position where it is safe to do so and/or permitted.

commands.name: Start
commands.description: Upon receipt, the device SHALL start its operation if it is safe to do so and the device is in an operational state from which it can be started.

commands.name: Resume
commands.description: Upon receipt, the device SHALL resume its operation from the point it was at when it received the Pause command, or from the point when it was paused by means outside of this cluster (for example by manual button press).

commands.name: OperationalCommandResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated in response to any of the Start, Stop, Pause, or Resume commands.

events.name: OperationalError
events.description: OperationalError

events.name: OperationCompletion
events.description: OperationCompletion

User Label.name: User Label
User Label.description: The User Label Cluster provides a feature to tag an endpoint with zero or more labels.

On/Off.name: On/Off
On/Off.description: Attributes and commands for switching devices between 'On' and 'Off' states.

commands.name: Off
commands.description: On receipt of this command, a device SHALL enter its Off state. This state is device dependent, but it is recommended that it is used for power off or similar functions. On receipt of the Off command, the OnTime attribute SHALL be set to 0.

commands.name: On
commands.description: On receipt of this command, a device SHALL enter its On state. This state is device dependent, but it is recommended that it is used for power on or similar functions. On receipt of the On command, if the value of the OnTime attribute is equal to 0, the device SHALL set the OffWaitTime attribute to 0.

commands.name: Toggle
commands.description: On receipt of this command, if a device is in its Off state it SHALL enter its On state. Otherwise, if it is in its On state it SHALL enter its Off state. On receipt of the Toggle command, if the value of the OnOff attribute is equal to FALSE and if the value of the OnTime attribute is equal to 0, the device SHALL set the OffWaitTime attribute to 0. If the value of the OnOff attribute is equal to TRUE, the OnTime attribute SHALL be set to 0.

commands.name: OffWithEffect
commands.description: The OffWithEffect command allows devices to be turned off using enhanced ways of fading.

commands.name: OnWithRecallGlobalScene
commands.description: The OnWithRecallGlobalScene command allows the recall of the settings when the device was turned off.

commands.name: OnWithTimedOff
commands.description: The OnWithTimedOff command allows devices to be turned on for a specific duration with a guarded off duration so that SHOULD the device be subsequently switched off, further OnWithTimedOff commands, received during this time, are prevented from turning the devices back on.

Energy EVSE Mode.name: Energy EVSE Mode
Energy EVSE Mode.description: Attributes and commands for selecting a mode from a list of supported options.

commands.name: ChangeToMode
commands.description: This command is used to change device modes.

commands.name: ChangeToModeResponse
commands.description: This command is sent by the device on receipt of the ChangeToMode command.

Ecosystem Information.name: Ecosystem Information
Ecosystem Information.description: Provides extended device information for all the logical devices represented by a Bridged Node.

Audio Output.name: Audio Output
Audio Output.description: This cluster provides an interface for controlling the Output on a media device such as a TV.

commands.name: SelectOutput
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL change the output on the media device to the output at a specific index in the Output List.

commands.name: RenameOutput
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL rename the output at a specific index in the Output List. Updates to the output name SHALL appear in the TV settings menus.

Localization Configuration.name: Localization Configuration
Localization Configuration.description:
Nodes should be expected to be deployed to any and all regions of the world. These global regions
      may have differing common languages, units of measurements, and numerical formatting
      standards. As such, Nodes that visually or audibly convey information need a mechanism by which
      they can be configured to use a users preferred language, units, etc

Target Navigator.name: Target Navigator
Target Navigator.description: This cluster provides an interface for UX navigation within a set of targets on a device or endpoint.

commands.name: NavigateTarget
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL navigation the UX to the target identified.

commands.name: NavigateTargetResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated in response to NavigateTarget commands.

events.name: TargetUpdated
events.description: This field SHALL indicate the updated target list as defined by the TargetList attribute if there is a change in the list of targets. Otherwise this field can be omitted from the event.

Operational State.name: Operational State
Operational State.description: This cluster supports remotely monitoring and, where supported, changing the operational state of any device where a state machine is a part of the operation.

commands.name: Pause
commands.description: Upon receipt, the device SHALL pause its operation if it is possible based on the current function of the server.

commands.name: Stop
commands.description: Upon receipt, the device SHALL stop its operation if it is at a position where it is safe to do so and/or permitted.

commands.name: Start
commands.description: Upon receipt, the device SHALL start its operation if it is safe to do so and the device is in an operational state from which it can be started.

commands.name: Resume
commands.description: Upon receipt, the device SHALL resume its operation from the point it was at when it received the Pause command, or from the point when it was paused by means outside of this cluster (for example by manual button press).

commands.name: OperationalCommandResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated in response to any of the Start, Stop, Pause, or Resume commands.

events.name: OperationalError
events.description: OperationalError

events.name: OperationCompletion
events.description: OperationCompletion

Basic Information.name: Basic Information
Basic Information.description:
This cluster provides attributes and events for determining basic information about Nodes, which supports both
      Commissioning and operational determination of Node characteristics, such as Vendor ID, Product ID and serial number,
      which apply to the whole Node. Also allows setting user device information such as location.

events.name: StartUp
events.description: The StartUp event SHALL be emitted by a Node as soon as reasonable after completing a boot or reboot process.

events.name: ShutDown
events.description: The ShutDown event SHOULD be emitted by a Node prior to any orderly shutdown sequence on a best-effort basis.

events.name: Leave
events.description: The Leave event SHOULD be emitted by a Node prior to permanently leaving the Fabric.

events.name: ReachableChanged
events.description: This event (when supported) SHALL be generated when there is a change in the Reachable attribute.

Pump Configuration and Control.name: Pump Configuration and Control
Pump Configuration and Control.description: An interface for configuring and controlling pumps.

events.name: SupplyVoltageLow
events.description: SupplyVoltageLow

events.name: SupplyVoltageHigh
events.description: SupplyVoltageHigh

events.name: PowerMissingPhase
events.description: PowerMissingPhase

events.name: SystemPressureLow
events.description: SystemPressureLow

events.name: SystemPressureHigh
events.description: SystemPressureHigh

events.name: DryRunning
events.description: DryRunning

events.name: MotorTemperatureHigh
events.description: MotorTemperatureHigh

events.name: PumpMotorFatalFailure
events.description: PumpMotorFatalFailure

events.name: ElectronicTemperatureHigh
events.description: ElectronicTemperatureHigh

events.name: PumpBlocked
events.description: PumpBlocked

events.name: SensorFailure
events.description: SensorFailure

events.name: ElectronicNonFatalFailure
events.description: ElectronicNonFatalFailure

events.name: ElectronicFatalFailure
events.description: ElectronicFatalFailure

events.name: GeneralFault
events.description: GeneralFault

events.name: Leakage
events.description: Leakage

events.name: AirDetection
events.description: AirDetection

events.name: TurbineOperation
events.description: TurbineOperation

Descriptor.name: Descriptor
Descriptor.description: The Descriptor Cluster is meant to replace the support from the Zigbee Device Object (ZDO) for describing a node, its endpoints and clusters.

Demand Response Load Control.name: Demand Response Load Control
Demand Response Load Control.description: This cluster provides an interface to the functionality of Smart Energy Demand Response and Load Control.

commands.name: RegisterLoadControlProgramRequest
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL insert a new LoadControlProgramStruct into LoadControlPrograms, or if the ProgramID matches an existing LoadControlProgramStruct, then the provider SHALL be updated with the provided values.

commands.name: UnregisterLoadControlProgramRequest
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL remove a the LoadControlProgramStruct from LoadControlPrograms with the matching ProgramID.

commands.name: AddLoadControlEventRequest
commands.description: On receipt of the AddLoadControlEventsRequest command, the server SHALL add a load control event.

commands.name: RemoveLoadControlEventRequest
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL remove the LoadControlEventStruct with the matching EventID from LoadEventPrograms.

commands.name: ClearLoadControlEventsRequest
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL clear all the load control events.

events.name: LoadControlEventStatusChange
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when the status of a LoadControlEventStruct changes.

HEPA Filter Monitoring.name: HEPA Filter Monitoring
HEPA Filter Monitoring.description: Attributes and commands for monitoring HEPA filters in a device

commands.name: ResetCondition
commands.description: Reset the condition of the replaceable to the non degraded state

Activated Carbon Filter Monitoring.name: Activated Carbon Filter Monitoring
Activated Carbon Filter Monitoring.description: Attributes and commands for monitoring activated carbon filters in a device

commands.name: ResetCondition
commands.description: Reset the condition of the replaceable to the non degraded state

Media Input.name: Media Input
Media Input.description: This cluster provides an interface for controlling the Input Selector on a media device such as a TV.

commands.name: SelectInput
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL change the input on the media device to the input at a specific index in the Input List.

commands.name: ShowInputStatus
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL display the active status of the input list on screen.

commands.name: HideInputStatus
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL hide the input list from the screen.

commands.name: RenameInput
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL rename the input at a specific index in the Input List. Updates to the input name SHALL appear in the TV settings menus.

Ethernet Network Diagnostics.name: Ethernet Network Diagnostics
Ethernet Network Diagnostics.description: The Ethernet Network Diagnostics Cluster provides a means to acquire standardized diagnostics metrics that MAY be used by a Node to assist a user or Administrative Node in diagnosing potential problems.

commands.name: ResetCounts
commands.description: Reception of this command SHALL reset the attributes: PacketRxCount, PacketTxCount, TxErrCount, CollisionCount, OverrunCount to 0

Occupancy Sensing.name: Occupancy Sensing
Occupancy Sensing.description: The server cluster provides an interface to occupancy sensing functionality based on one or more sensing modalities, including configuration and provision of notifications of occupancy status.

events.name: OccupancyChanged
events.description: If this event is supported, it SHALL be generated when the Occupancy attribute changes.

Device Energy Management.name: Device Energy Management
Device Energy Management.description: This cluster allows a client to manage the power draw of a device. An example of such a client could be an Energy Management System (EMS) which controls an Energy Smart Appliance (ESA).

commands.name: PowerAdjustRequest
commands.description: Allows a client to request an adjustment in the power consumption of an ESA for a specified duration.

commands.name: CancelPowerAdjustRequest
commands.description: Allows a client to cancel an ongoing PowerAdjustmentRequest operation.

commands.name: StartTimeAdjustRequest
commands.description: Allows a client to adjust the start time of a Forecast sequence that has not yet started operation (i.e. where the current Forecast StartTime is in the future).

commands.name: PauseRequest
commands.description: Allows a client to temporarily pause an operation and reduce the ESAs energy demand.

commands.name: ResumeRequest
commands.description: Allows a client to cancel the PauseRequest command and enable earlier resumption of operation.

commands.name: ModifyForecastRequest
commands.description: Allows a client to modify a Forecast within the limits allowed by the ESA.

commands.name: RequestConstraintBasedForecast
commands.description: Allows a client to ask the ESA to recompute its Forecast based on power and time constraints.

commands.name: CancelRequest
commands.description: Allows a client to request cancellation of a previous adjustment request in a StartTimeAdjustRequest, ModifyForecastRequest or RequestConstraintBasedForecast command.

events.name: PowerAdjustStart
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when the Power Adjustment session is started.

events.name: PowerAdjustEnd
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when the Power Adjustment session ends.

events.name: Paused
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when the ESA enters the Paused state.

events.name: Resumed
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when the ESA leaves the Paused state and resumes operation.

Water Heater Mode.name: Water Heater Mode
Water Heater Mode.description: Attributes and commands for selecting a mode from a list of supported options.

commands.name: ChangeToMode
commands.description: This command is used to change device modes.

commands.name: ChangeToModeResponse
commands.description: This command is sent by the device on receipt of the ChangeToMode command.

Diagnostic Logs.name: Diagnostic Logs
Diagnostic Logs.description: The cluster provides commands for retrieving unstructured diagnostic logs from a Node that may be used to aid in diagnostics.

commands.name: RetrieveLogsRequest
commands.description: Retrieving diagnostic logs from a Node

commands.name: RetrieveLogsResponse
commands.description: Response to the RetrieveLogsRequest

Content Control.name: Content Control
Content Control.description: This cluster is used for managing the content control (including "parental control") settings on a media device such as a TV, or Set-top Box.

commands.name: UpdatePIN
commands.description: The purpose of this command is to update the PIN used for protecting configuration of the content control settings. Upon success, the old PIN SHALL no longer work. The PIN is used to ensure that only the Node (or User) with the PIN code can make changes to the Content Control settings, for example, turn off Content Controls or modify the ScreenDailyTime. The PIN is composed of a numeric string of up to 6 human readable characters (displayable) . Upon receipt of this command, the media device SHALL check if the OldPIN field of this command is the same as the current PIN. If the PINs are the same, then the PIN code SHALL be set to NewPIN. Otherwise a response with InvalidPINCode error status SHALL be returned. The media device MAY provide a default PIN to the User via an out of band mechanism. For security reasons, it is recommended that a client encourage the user to update the PIN from its default value when performing configuration of the Content Control settings exposed by this cluster. The ResetPIN command can also be used to obtain the default PIN.

commands.name: ResetPIN
commands.description: The purpose of this command is to reset the PIN. If this command is executed successfully, a ResetPINResponse command with a new PIN SHALL be returned.

commands.name: ResetPINResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated in response to a ResetPIN command. The data for this command SHALL be as follows:

commands.name: Enable
commands.description: The purpose of this command is to turn on the Content Control feature on a media device. On receipt of the Enable command, the media device SHALL set the Enabled attribute to TRUE.

commands.name: Disable
commands.description: The purpose of this command is to turn off the Content Control feature on a media device. On receipt of the Disable command, the media device SHALL set the Enabled attribute to FALSE.

commands.name: AddBonusTime
commands.description: The purpose of this command is to add the extra screen time for the user. If a client with Operate privilege invokes this command, the media device SHALL check whether the PINCode passed in the command matches the current PINCode value. If these match, then the RemainingScreenTime attribute SHALL be increased by the specified BonusTime value. If the PINs do not match, then a response with InvalidPINCode error status SHALL be returned, and no changes SHALL be made to RemainingScreenTime. If a client with Manage privilege or greater invokes this command, the media device SHALL ignore the PINCode field and directly increase the RemainingScreenTime attribute by the specified BonusTime value. A server that does not support the PM feature SHALL respond with InvalidPINCode to clients that only have Operate privilege unless: It has been provided with the PIN value to expect via an out of band mechanism, and The client has provided a PINCode that matches the expected PIN value.

commands.name: SetScreenDailyTime
commands.description: The purpose of this command is to set the ScreenDailyTime attribute. On receipt of the SetScreenDailyTime command, the media device SHALL set the ScreenDailyTime attribute to the ScreenTime value.

commands.name: BlockUnratedContent
commands.description: The purpose of this command is to specify whether programs with no Content rating must be blocked by this media device. On receipt of the BlockUnratedContent command, the media device SHALL set the BlockUnrated attribute to TRUE.

commands.name: UnblockUnratedContent
commands.description: The purpose of this command is to specify whether programs with no Content rating must be blocked by this media device. On receipt of the UnblockUnratedContent command, the media device SHALL set the BlockUnrated attribute to FALSE.

commands.name: SetOnDemandRatingThreshold
commands.description: The purpose of this command is to set the OnDemandRatingThreshold attribute. On receipt of the SetOnDemandRatingThreshold command, the media device SHALL check if the Rating field is one of values present in the OnDemandRatings attribute. If not, then a response with InvalidRating error status SHALL be returned.

commands.name: SetScheduledContentRatingThreshold
commands.description: The purpose of this command is to set ScheduledContentRatingThreshold attribute. On receipt of the SetScheduledContentRatingThreshold command, the media device SHALL check if the Rating field is one of values present in the ScheduledContentRatings attribute. If not, then a response with InvalidRating error status SHALL be returned.

events.name: RemainingScreenTimeExpired
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when the RemainingScreenTime equals 0.

Chime.name: Chime
Chime.description: This cluster provides facilities to configure and play Chime sounds, such as those used in a doorbell.

Dishwasher Mode.name: Dishwasher Mode
Dishwasher Mode.description: Attributes and commands for selecting a mode from a list of supported options.

commands.name: ChangeToMode

        On receipt of this command the device SHALL respond with a ChangeToModeResponse command.

Refrigerator And Temperature Controlled.name: Refrigerator And Temperature Controlled Cabinet Mode
Refrigerator And Temperature Controlled.description: Attributes and commands for selecting a mode from a list of supported options.

commands.name: ChangeToMode
