Carbon Monoxide Concentration Measuremen.description: Attributes for reporting carbon monoxide concentration measurements

Carbon Dioxide Concentration Measurement.name: Carbon Dioxide Concentration Measurement
Carbon Dioxide Concentration Measurement.description: Attributes for reporting carbon dioxide concentration measurements

Nitrogen Dioxide Concentration Measureme.name: Nitrogen Dioxide Concentration Measurement
Nitrogen Dioxide Concentration Measureme.description: Attributes for reporting nitrogen dioxide concentration measurements

Ozone Concentration Measurement.name: Ozone Concentration Measurement
Ozone Concentration Measurement.description: Attributes for reporting ozone concentration measurements

PM2.5 Concentration Measurement.name: PM2.5 Concentration Measurement
PM2.5 Concentration Measurement.description: Attributes for reporting PM2.5 concentration measurements

Formaldehyde Concentration Measurement.name: Formaldehyde Concentration Measurement
Formaldehyde Concentration Measurement.description: Attributes for reporting formaldehyde concentration measurements

PM1 Concentration Measurement.name: PM1 Concentration Measurement
PM1 Concentration Measurement.description: Attributes for reporting PM1 concentration measurements

PM10 Concentration Measurement.name: PM10 Concentration Measurement
PM10 Concentration Measurement.description: Attributes for reporting PM10 concentration measurements

Total Volatile Organic Compounds Concent.name: Total Volatile Organic Compounds Concentration Measurement
Total Volatile Organic Compounds Concent.description: Attributes for reporting total volatile organic compounds concentration measurements

Radon Concentration Measurement.name: Radon Concentration Measurement
Radon Concentration Measurement.description: Attributes for reporting radon concentration measurements

Channel.name: Channel
Channel.description: This cluster provides an interface for controlling the current Channel on a device.

commands.name: ChangeChannel
commands.description: Change the channel on the media player to the channel case-insensitive exact matching the value passed as an argument.

commands.name: ChangeChannelByNumber
commands.description: Change the channel on the media plaeyer to the channel with the given Number in the ChannelList attribute.

commands.name: SkipChannel
commands.description: This command provides channel up and channel down functionality, but allows channel index jumps of size Count. When the value of the increase or decrease is larger than the number of channels remaining in the given direction, then the behavior SHALL be to return to the beginning (or end) of the channel list and continue. For example, if the current channel is at index 0 and count value of -1 is given, then the current channel should change to the last channel.

commands.name: ChangeChannelResponse
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL display the active status of the input list on screen.

commands.name: GetProgramGuide
commands.description: This command retrieves the program guide. It accepts several filter parameters to return specific schedule and program information from a content app. The command shall receive in response a ProgramGuideResponse.

commands.name: ProgramGuideResponse
commands.description: This command is a response to the GetProgramGuide command.

commands.name: RecordProgram
commands.description: Record a specific program or series when it goes live. This functionality enables DVR recording features.

commands.name: CancelRecordProgram
commands.description: Cancel recording for a specific program or series.

Push AV Stream Transport.name: Push AV Stream Transport
Push AV Stream Transport.description: This cluster implements the upload of Audio and Video streams from the Push AV Stream Transport Cluster using suitable push-based transports.

commands.name: AllocatePushTransport
commands.description: This command SHALL allocate a transport and return a PushTransportConnectionID.

commands.name: AllocatePushTransportResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated in response to an AllocatePushTransport command.

commands.name: DeallocatePushTransport
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated to request the Node deallocates the specified transport.

commands.name: ModifyPushTransport
commands.description: This command is used to request the Node modifies the configuration of the specified push transport.

commands.name: SetTransportStatus
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated to request the Node modifies the Transport Status of the transport.

commands.name: ManuallyTriggerTransport
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated to request the Node to manually start the specified push transport.

commands.name: FindTransport
commands.description: This command SHALL return the Stream Options Configuration for the specified push transport.

commands.name: FindTransportResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated in response to a FindTransport command.

events.name: PushTransportBegin
events.description: This event SHALL indicate a push transport transmission has begun.

events.name: PushTransportEnd
events.description: This event SHALL indicate a push transport transmission has ended.

Wake on LAN.name: Wake on LAN
Wake on LAN.description: This cluster provides an interface for managing low power mode on a device that supports the Wake On LAN protocol.

Service Area.name: Service Area
Service Area.description: The Service Area cluster provides an interface for controlling the areas where a device should operate, and for querying the current area being serviced.

commands.name: SelectAreas

commands.name: SelectAreasResponse
commands.description: This command is sent by the device on receipt of the SelectAreas command.

commands.name: SkipArea
commands.description: This command is used to skip an area where the device operates.

commands.name: SkipAreaResponse
commands.description: This command is sent by the device on receipt of the SkipArea command.

Low Power.name: Low Power
Low Power.description: This cluster provides an interface for managing low power mode on a device.

commands.name: Sleep

Temperature Measurement.name: Temperature Measurement
Temperature Measurement.description: Attributes and commands for configuring the measurement of temperature, and reporting temperature measurements.

Flow Measurement.name: Flow Measurement
Flow Measurement.description: Attributes and commands for configuring the measurement of flow, and reporting flow measurements.

Wi-Fi Network Diagnostics.name: Wi-Fi Network Diagnostics
Wi-Fi Network Diagnostics.description: The Wi-Fi Network Diagnostics Cluster provides a means to acquire standardized diagnostics metrics that MAY be used by a Node to assist a user or Administrative Node in diagnosing potential problems.

commands.name: ResetCounts
commands.description: Reception of this command SHALL reset the Breacon and Packet related count attributes to 0

events.name: Disconnection
events.description: Indicate that a Nodes Wi-Fi connection has been disconnected as a result of de-authenticated or dis-association and indicates the reason.

events.name: AssociationFailure
events.description: Indicate that a Node has failed to connect, or reconnect, to a Wi-Fi access point.

events.name: ConnectionStatus
events.description: Indicate that a Nodes connection status to a Wi-Fi network has changed.

Thermostat.name: Thermostat
Thermostat.description: An interface for configuring and controlling the functionality of a thermostat.

commands.name: SetpointRaiseLower

commands.name: SetWeeklySchedule

commands.name: SetActiveScheduleRequest

commands.name: SetActivePresetRequest

commands.name: GetWeeklyScheduleResponse

commands.name: AtomicResponse

commands.name: AtomicRequest
commands.description: Begins, Commits or Cancels an atomic write

Level Control.name: Level Control
Level Control.description: Attributes and commands for controlling devices that can be set to a level between fully 'On' and fully 'Off.'

Time Format Localization.name: Time Format Localization
Time Format Localization.description:
Nodes should be expected to be deployed to any and all regions of the world. These global regions
      may have differing preferences for how dates and times are conveyed. As such, Nodes that visually
      or audibly convey time information need a mechanism by which they can be configured to use a
      users preferred format.

WebRTC Transport Provider.name: WebRTC Transport Provider
WebRTC Transport Provider.description: The WebRTC transport provider cluster provides a way for stream providers (e.g. Cameras) to stream or receive their data through WebRTC.

commands.name: SolicitOffer
commands.description: Requests that the Provider initiates a new session with the Offer / Answer flow in a way that allows for options to be passed and work with devices needing the standby flow.

commands.name: SolicitOfferResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated in response to a SolicitOffer command.

commands.name: ProvideOffer
commands.description: This command allows an SDP Offer to be set and start a new session.

commands.name: ProvideOfferResponse
commands.description: This command contains information about the session and streams created as a response to the requestor's offer.

commands.name: ProvideAnswer
commands.description: This command SHALL be initiated from a Node in response to an Offer that was previously received from a remote peer.

commands.name: ProvideICECandidates
commands.description: This command allows for string based https://rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc8839#section-5.1 generated after the initial Offer / Answer exchange, via a JSEP https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc9429#section-4.1.20 event, a DOM https://www.w3.org/TR/webrtc/#dom-rtcpeerconnectioniceevent event, or other WebRTC compliant implementations, to be added to a session during the gathering phase.

commands.name: EndSession
commands.description: This command instructs the stream provider to end the WebRTC session.

General Diagnostics.name: General Diagnostics
General Diagnostics.description: The General Diagnostics Cluster, along with other diagnostics clusters, provide a means to acquire standardized diagnostics metrics that MAY be used by a Node to assist a user or Administrative Node in diagnosing potential problems.

commands.name: TestEventTrigger
commands.description: Provide a means for certification tests to trigger some test-plan-specific events

commands.name: TimeSnapshot
commands.description: Take a snapshot of system time and epoch time.

commands.name: TimeSnapshotResponse
commands.description: Response for the TimeSnapshot command.

commands.name: PayloadTestRequest
commands.description: Request a variable length payload response.

commands.name: PayloadTestResponse
commands.description: Response for the PayloadTestRequest command.

events.name: HardwareFaultChange
events.description: Indicate a change in the set of hardware faults currently detected by the Node.

events.name: RadioFaultChange
events.description: Indicate a change in the set of radio faults currently detected by the Node.

events.name: NetworkFaultChange
events.description: Indicate a change in the set of network faults currently detected by the Node.

events.name: BootReason
events.description: Indicate the reason that caused the device to start-up.

Scenes Management.name: Scenes Management
Scenes Management.description: Attributes and commands for scene configuration and manipulation.

commands.name: AddScene
commands.description: Add a scene to the scene table. Extension field sets are supported, and are inputed as '{"ClusterID": VALUE, "AttributeValueList":[{"AttributeID": VALUE, "Value*": VALUE}]}'

commands.name: ViewScene
commands.description: Retrieves the requested scene entry from its Scene table.

commands.name: RemoveScene
commands.description: Removes the requested scene entry, corresponding to the value of the GroupID field, from its Scene Table

commands.name: RemoveAllScenes
commands.description: Remove all scenes, corresponding to the value of the GroupID field, from its Scene Table

commands.name: StoreScene
commands.description: Adds the scene entry into its Scene Table along with all extension field sets corresponding to the current state of other clusters on the same endpoint

commands.name: RecallScene
commands.description: Set the attributes and corresponding state for each other cluster implemented on the endpoint accordingly to the resquested scene entry in the Scene Table

commands.name: GetSceneMembership
commands.description: Get an unused scene identifier when no commissioning tool is in the network, or for a commissioning tool to get the used scene identifiers within a certain group

commands.name: CopyScene
commands.description: Allows a client to efficiently copy scenes from one group/scene identifier pair to another group/scene identifier pair.

commands.name: AddSceneResponse
commands.description: The command is generated in response to a received unicast AddScene command,

commands.name: ViewSceneResponse
commands.description: The command is generated in response to a received unicast ViewScene command

commands.name: RemoveSceneResponse
commands.description: The command is generated in response to a received unicast RemoveScene command

commands.name: RemoveAllScenesResponse
commands.description: The command is generated in response to a received unicast RemoveAllScenes command

commands.name: StoreSceneResponse
commands.description: The command is generated in response to a received unicast StoreScene command

commands.name: GetSceneMembershipResponse
commands.description: The command is generated in response to a received unicast GetSceneMembership command

commands.name: CopySceneResponse
commands.description: The command is generated in response to a received unicast CopyScene command

Boolean State Configuration.name: Boolean State Configuration
Boolean State Configuration.description: This cluster is used to configure a boolean sensor.

commands.name: SuppressAlarm
commands.description: This command is used to suppress the specified alarm mode.

commands.name: EnableDisableAlarm
commands.description: This command is used to enable or disable the specified alarm mode.

events.name: AlarmsStateChanged
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when any bits in the AlarmsActive and/or AlarmsSuppressed attributes change.

events.name: SensorFault
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when the device registers or clears a fault.

Administrator Commissioning.name: Administrator Commissioning
Administrator Commissioning.description: Commands to trigger a Node to allow a new Administrator to commission it.

commands.name: OpenCommissioningWindow
commands.description: This command is used by a current Administrator to instruct a Node to go into commissioning mode using enhanced commissioning method.

commands.name: OpenBasicCommissioningWindow
commands.description: This command is used by a current Administrator to instruct a Node to go into commissioning mode using basic commissioning method, if the node supports it.

commands.name: RevokeCommissioning
commands.description: This command is used by a current Administrator to instruct a Node to revoke any active Open Commissioning Window or Open Basic Commissioning Window command.

Device Energy Management Mode.name: Device Energy Management Mode
Device Energy Management Mode.description: Attributes and commands for selecting a mode from a list of supported options.

commands.name: ChangeToMode
commands.description: This command is used to change device modes.

commands.name: ChangeToModeResponse
commands.description: This command is sent by the device on receipt of the ChangeToMode command.

Mode Select.name: Mode Select
Mode Select.description: Attributes and commands for selecting a mode from a list of supported options.

commands.name: ChangeToMode
commands.description: On receipt of this command, if the NewMode field matches the Mode field in an entry of the SupportedModes list, the server SHALL set the CurrentMode attribute to the NewMode value, otherwise, the server SHALL respond with an INVALID_COMMAND status response.

Smoke CO Alarm.name: Smoke CO Alarm
Smoke CO Alarm.description: This cluster provides an interface for observing and managing the state of smoke and CO alarms.

commands.name: SelfTestRequest
commands.description: This command SHALL initiate a device self-test.

events.name: SmokeAlarm
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when SmokeState attribute changes to either Warning or Critical state.

events.name: COAlarm
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when COState attribute changes to either Warning or Critical state.

events.name: LowBattery
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when BatteryAlert attribute changes to either Warning or Critical state.

events.name: HardwareFault
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when the device detects a hardware fault that leads to setting HardwareFaultAlert to True.

events.name: EndOfService
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when the EndOfServiceAlert is set to Expired.

events.name: SelfTestComplete
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when the SelfTest completes, and the attribute TestInProgress changes to False.

events.name: AlarmMuted
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when the DeviceMuted attribute changes to Muted.

events.name: MuteEnded
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when DeviceMuted attribute changes to NotMuted.

events.name: InterconnectSmokeAlarm
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when the device hosting the server receives a smoke alarm from an interconnected sensor.

events.name: InterconnectCOAlarm
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when the device hosting the server receives a smoke alarm from an interconnected sensor.

events.name: AllClear
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when ExpressedState attribute returns to Normal state.

Electrical Energy Measurement.name: Electrical Energy Measurement
Electrical Energy Measurement.description: This cluster provides a mechanism for querying data about the electrical energy imported or provided by the server.

events.name: CumulativeEnergyMeasured
events.description: CumulativeEnergyMeasured

events.name: PeriodicEnergyMeasured
events.description: PeriodicEnergyMeasured

Illuminance Measurement.name: Illuminance Measurement
Illuminance Measurement.description: Attributes and commands for configuring the measurement of illuminance, and reporting illuminance measurements.

Air Quality.name: Air Quality
Air Quality.description: Attributes for reporting air quality classification

Camera AV Stream Management.name: Camera AV Stream Management
Camera AV Stream Management.description: The Camera AV Stream Management cluster is used to allow clients to manage, control, and configure various audio, video, and snapshot streams on a camera.

commands.name: AudioStreamAllocate
commands.description: This command SHALL allocate an audio stream on the camera and return an allocated audio stream identifier.

commands.name: AudioStreamAllocateResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be sent by the camera in response to the AudioStreamAllocate command, carrying the newly allocated audio stream identifier.

commands.name: AudioStreamDeallocate
commands.description: This command SHALL deallocate an audio stream on the camera, corresponding to the given audio stream identifier.

commands.name: VideoStreamAllocate
commands.description: This command SHALL allocate a video stream on the camera and return an allocated video stream identifier.

commands.name: VideoStreamAllocateResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be sent by the camera in response to the VideoStreamAllocate command, carrying the newly allocated video stream identifier.

commands.name: VideoStreamModify
commands.description: This command SHALL be used to modify a stream specified by the VideoStreamID.

commands.name: VideoStreamDeallocate
commands.description: This command SHALL deallocate a video stream on the camera, corresponding to the given video stream identifier.

commands.name: SnapshotStreamAllocate
commands.description: This command SHALL allocate a snapshot stream on the device and return an allocated snapshot stream identifier.

commands.name: SnapshotStreamAllocateResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be sent by the device in response to the SnapshotStreamAllocate command, carrying the newly allocated snapshot stream identifier.

commands.name: SnapshotStreamDeallocate
commands.description: This command SHALL deallocate an snapshot stream on the camera, corresponding to the given snapshot stream identifier.

commands.name: SetStreamPriorities
commands.description: This command SHALL set the relative priorities of the various stream usages on the camera.

commands.name: CaptureSnapshot
commands.description: This command SHALL return a Snapshot from the camera.

commands.name: CaptureSnapshotResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be sent by the device in response to the CaptureSnapshot command, carrying the requested snapshot.

events.name: VideoStreamChanged
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when there is a modification in the corresponding video stream.

events.name: AudioStreamChanged
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when there is a modification in the corresponding audio stream.

events.name: SnapshotStreamChanged
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when there is a modification in the corresponding snapshot stream.

Laundry Washer Controls.name: Laundry Washer Controls
Laundry Washer Controls.description: This cluster supports remotely monitoring and controlling the different types of functionality available to a washing device, such as a washing machine.

Pulse Width Modulation.name: Pulse Width Modulation
Pulse Width Modulation.description: Cluster to control pulse width modulation

Unit Testing.name: Unit Testing
Unit Testing.description: The Test Cluster is meant to validate the generated code

commands.name: Test
commands.description:
Simple command without any parameters and without a specific response.
        To aid in unit testing, this command will re-initialize attribute storage to defaults.

commands.name: TestNotHandled
commands.description: Simple command without any parameters and without a specific response not handled by the server

commands.name: TestSpecific
commands.description: Simple command without any parameters and with a specific response

commands.name: TestUnknownCommand
commands.description: Simple command that should not be added to the server.

commands.name: TestAddArguments
commands.description: Command that takes two arguments and returns their sum.

commands.name: TestSimpleArgumentRequest
commands.description: Command that takes an argument which is bool

commands.name: TestStructArrayArgumentRequest
commands.description: Command that takes various arguments that are arrays, including an array of structs which have a list member.

commands.name: TestStructArgumentRequest
commands.description:
Command that takes an argument which is struct.  The response echoes the
        'b' field of the single arg.

commands.name: TestNestedStructArgumentRequest
commands.description:
Command that takes an argument which is nested struct.  The response
        echoes the 'b' field of ar1.c.

commands.name: TestListStructArgumentRequest
commands.description:
Command that takes an argument which is a list of structs.  The response
        returns false if there is some struct in the list whose 'b' field is
        false, and true otherwise (including if the list is empty).

commands.name: TestListInt8UArgumentRequest
commands.description:
Command that takes an argument which is a list of INT8U.  The response
        returns false if the list contains a 0 in it, true otherwise (including
        if the list is empty).

commands.name: TestNestedStructListArgumentRequest
commands.description:
Command that takes an argument which is a Nested Struct List.  The
        response returns false if there is some struct in arg1 (either directly
        in arg1.c or in the arg1.d list) whose 'b' field is false, and true
        otherwise.

commands.name: TestListNestedStructListArgumentRequest
commands.description:
Command that takes an argument which is a list of Nested Struct List.
        The response returns false if there is some struct in arg1 (either
        directly in as the 'c' field of an entry 'd' list of an entry) whose 'b'
        field is false, and true otherwise (including if the list is empty).

commands.name: TestListInt8UReverseRequest
commands.description:
Command that takes an argument which is a list of INT8U and expects a
        response that reverses the list.

commands.name: TestEnumsRequest
commands.description:
Command that sends a vendor id and an enum.  The server is expected to
        echo them back.

commands.name: TestNullableOptionalRequest
commands.description:
Command that takes an argument which is nullable and optional.  The
        response returns a boolean indicating whether the argument was present,
        if that's true a boolean indicating whether the argument was null, and
        if that' false the argument it received.

commands.name: TestComplexNullableOptionalRequest
commands.description:
Command that takes various arguments which can be nullable and/or optional.  The
        response returns information about which things were received and what
        their state was.

commands.name: SimpleStructEchoRequest
commands.description:
Command that takes an argument which is a struct.  The response echoes
        the struct back.

commands.name: TimedInvokeRequest
commands.description:
Command that just responds with a success status if the timed invoke
        conditions are met.

commands.name: TestSimpleOptionalArgumentRequest
commands.description: Command that takes an optional argument which is bool. It responds with a success value if the optional is set to any value.

commands.name: TestEmitTestEventRequest
commands.description: Command that takes identical arguments to the fields of the TestEvent and logs the TestEvent to the buffer.  Command returns an event ID as the response.

commands.name: TestEmitTestFabricScopedEventRequest
commands.description: Command that takes identical arguments to the fields of the TestFabricScopedEvent and logs the TestFabricScopedEvent to the buffer.  Command returns an event ID as the response.

commands.name: TestBatchHelperRequest
commands.description: Command that responds after sleepBeforeResponseTimeMs with an octet_string the size requested with fillCharacter.

commands.name: TestSecondBatchHelperRequest
commands.description: Second command that responds after sleepBeforeResponseTimeMs with an octet_string the size requested with fillCharacter.

commands.name: StringEchoRequest
commands.description:
Command that takes an argument which is an octet string.  The response echoes
        the string back. If the string is large then it would require a session that
        supports large payloads.

commands.name: GlobalEchoRequest
commands.description:
Command that takes arguments that are global structs/enums and the
        response just echoes them back.

commands.description: Command having a different MEI vendor ID than the cluster. Also emits TestDifferentVendorMeiEvent.

commands.name: TestSpecificResponse
commands.description: Simple response for TestWithResponse with a simple return value

commands.name: TestAddArgumentsResponse
commands.description: Response for TestAddArguments that returns the sum.

commands.name: TestSimpleArgumentResponse
commands.description: Simple response for TestSimpleArgumentRequest with a simple return value

commands.name: TestStructArrayArgumentResponse
commands.description: Response for TestStructArrayArgumentRequest with complicated return arguments

commands.name: TestListInt8UReverseResponse
commands.description: Response that delivers the reversed list of uint8.

commands.name: TestEnumsResponse
commands.description: Response that delivers a vendor id and an enum..

commands.name: TestNullableOptionalResponse
commands.description:
Delivers information about the argument TestNullableOptionalRequest had,
        and the original value if there was one.

commands.name: TestComplexNullableOptionalResponse
commands.description: Delivers information about the arguments TestComplexNullableOptionalRequest had.

commands.name: BooleanResponse
commands.description:
Delivers a single boolean argument. What the argument means depends on
        what we're responding to.

commands.name: SimpleStructResponse
commands.description:
Command that returns a single argument which is a struct.  The contents
        of the struct depend on what we are responding to.

commands.name: TestEmitTestEventResponse
commands.description: Delivers the ID of an event in response to test command emitting fabric scoped events.

commands.name: TestEmitTestFabricScopedEventResponse
commands.description: Delivers the ID of an event in response to test command emitting fabric scope events.

commands.name: TestBatchHelperResponse
commands.description: Response to TestBatchHelperRequest or TestSecondBatchHelperRequest. Buffer in response is filled as directed in the Request.

commands.name: StringEchoResponse
commands.description: Response to StringEchoRequest. Buffer in response is filled by the payload in the Request.

commands.name: GlobalEchoResponse
commands.description: Response to GlobalEchoRequest.

commands.name: TestDifferentVendorMeiResponse
commands.description: Response to TestDifferentVendorMeiRequest, which is a command having a different MEI vendor ID than the cluster.

Color Control.name: Color Control
Color Control.description: Attributes and commands for controlling the color properties of a color-capable light.

commands.name: MoveToHue
commands.description: Move to specified hue.

commands.name: MoveHue
commands.description: Move hue up or down at specified rate.

commands.name: StepHue
commands.description: Step hue up or down by specified size at specified rate.

commands.name: MoveToSaturation
commands.description: Move to specified saturation.

commands.name: MoveSaturation
commands.description: Move saturation up or down at specified rate.

commands.name: StepSaturation
commands.description: Step saturation up or down by specified size at specified rate.

commands.name: MoveToHueAndSaturation
commands.description: Move to hue and saturation.

commands.name: MoveToColor
commands.description: Move to specified color.

commands.name: MoveColor
commands.description: Moves the color.

commands.name: StepColor
commands.description: Steps the lighting to a specific color.

commands.name: MoveToColorTemperature
commands.description: Move to a specific color temperature.
